intro: Neoporteria curvispina f. gracilis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed neoporteria, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of this family. This particular form is noted for its reduced size and more refined appearance compared to the typical species. It is often found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in woodland or streamside habitats.
